subject: Track and Field
Sentences (Criminal)
Sex Crimes
Crime and Criminals
Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: A member of Trinidad and Tobago’s 4x100-meter relay team in the 2000 Olympics was sentenced to 21 years in prison after pleading guilty to raping a woman in a New York park. Prosecutors say Alvin Henry, 31, was dubbed the Lover’s Lane Rapist for secretly recording a woman having sex in the park with her boyfriend. They say he followed the woman and threatened to show the video unless she had sex with him.
